attributes.action: Demand Government reverse their decision to postpone local elections for a year
attributes.additional_details:
The government must allow these local elections to take place even if some Councillors have a potential short term of office.
The government want to create super local authorities each covering about 500,000 people.
This could result in less local power and more centralised power.
These proposals may not happen as there may not be agreement or local voters may decide against them in a referendum.
Such proposals should not be dictated but decided by local referenda,
which should be organised.
attributes.background:
We want all these local elections to go ahead this year.
Any extension of term of office should be approved by the local electorate and this has not been. His Majesty the King should not approve this undemocratic measure.
Any proposed reorganisation of local councils should have a local referendum

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions which call for similar action: 

Do not postpone the local elections
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/710155

Require local referenda when introducing new unitary and strategic authorities
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/711000
